verses.verse: Then I returned<WH7725> and saw<WH7200> all the oppressions<WH6217> that are done<WH6213> under the sun:<WH8121> and behold,<WH1832> the tears of those who were oppressed,<WH6231> and they had no comforter;<WH5162> and on the side<WH3027> of their oppressors<WH6231> there was power;<WH3581> but they had no comforter.<WH5162>
Therefore I praised<WH7623> the dead<WH4191> who have been<WH3528> long dead<WH4191> more than the living<WH2416> who are yet<WH5728> alive.<WH2416>
Yes,<WH2896> better than them both<WH8147> is him who has not yet<WH5728> been,<WH7200> who has not seen the evil<WH7451> work<WH4639> that is done<WH6213> under the sun.<WH8121>

Then I saw<WH7200> all the labor<WH5999> and<WH3788> achievement<WH4639> that is the envy<WH7068> of a man<WH376>'s neighbor.<WH7453> This also is vanity<WH1892> and a striving<WH7469> after wind.<WH7307>
The fool<WH3684> folds<WH2263> his hands<WH3027> together<WH2263> and ruins<WH398> himself.<WH1320>
Better<WH2896> is a handful,<WH3709> with quietness,<WH5183> than two<WH2651> handfuls<WH4393> with labor<WH5999> and chasing<WH7469> after wind.<WH7307>
Then I returned<WH7725> and saw<WH7200> vanity<WH1892> under the sun.<WH8121>

There is<WH3426> one<WH259> who is alone,<WH8145> and he has neither son<WH1121> nor brother.<WH251> There is no end<WH7093> to all of his labor,<WH5999> neither are his eyes<WH5869> satisfied<WH7646> with wealth.<WH6239> "For whom then,<WH6001> do I labor, and deprive<WH2637> my soul<WH5315> of enjoyment?<WH2896>" This also is vanity.<WH1892> Yes,<WH7451> it is a miserable business.<WH6045>
Two<WH8147> are better<WH2896> than one,<WH259> because they have<WH3426> a good<WH2896> reward<WH7939> for their labor.<WH5999>

For if they fall,<WH5307> the one<WH259> will lift up<WH6965> his fellow;<WH2270> but woe<WH337> to him who is alone<WH259> when he falls,<WH5307> and doesn't<WH8145> have another to lift him up.<WH6965>
Again,<WH1571> if two<WH8147> lie together,<WH7901> then they have warmth;<WH2552> but how can one<WH259> keep warm alone?<WH3179>
If a man<WH259> prevails<WH8630> against one who is alone,<WH8147> two shall withstand<WH5975> him;<WH8027> and a threefold cord<WH2339> is not quickly<WH4120> broken.<WH5423>
Better<WH2896> is a poor<WH4542> and wise<WH2450> youth<WH3206> than an old<WH2205> and foolish<WH3684> king<WH4428> who doesn't<WH3045> know how to receive admonition any more.<WH2094>
For out of prison<WH631> he came<WH3318> forth to be king;<WH4427> yes,<WH4438> even in his kingdom he was born<WH3205> poor.<WH7326>
I saw<WH7200> all the living<WH2416> who walk<WH1980> under the sun,<WH8121> that they were with the youth,<WH3206> the other,<WH8145> who succeeded him.<WH5975>

There was no end<WH7093> of all the people,<WH5971> even of all them over whom he was<WH6440>â€”yet those who come after<WH314> shall not rejoice<WH8055> in him.<WH1892> Surely this also is vanity and a chasing<WH7475> after wind.<WH7307>
